intro: Orobus aurantius, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Orobus aurantius is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, and it is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
